channel.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
channel.description:
I've recently set up a cross compiler so I can compile Linux, Windows, and Mac OSX programs all from Linux, and I can test Linux and Windows programs fairly well, but not OSX programs. Also different distributions of Linux tend to have different library versions, so that might be a problem too.
So can I have some people test out these simple, hello world programs on their systems: http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/test_cross/
run these from the command line, expected results are: [code]$ ./sample_CommandLine Hello, world![/code]
I'm particularly interested in Intel and PPC Mac OSX results, it should work on anything 10.4 or newer, please report back what happens, what version you are running, and under what architecture.
Thanks. :)

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

alex@euve19985:~$ cat /proc/version
Linux version 2.6.18-028stab070.3 (root@rhel5-build-x64) (gcc version 4.1.2 20080704 (Red Hat 4.1.2-46)) #1 SMP Wed Jul 21 18:33:27 MSD 2010
alex@euve19985:~$ ./sample_CommandLine.linux
Hello, world!

Read full topic

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

matt@matt-pc:~/Downloads$ cat /proc/version
Linux version 2.6.35-24-generic-pae (buildd@vernadsky) (gcc version 4.4.5 (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.4.4-14ubuntu5) ) #42-Ubuntu SMP Thu Dec 2 03:21:31 UTC 2010
matt@matt-pc:~/Downloads$ ./sample_CommandLine.linux
Hello, world!

Read full topic

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Good to see that so far the dynamically linked libraries are compatible. I’m going to statically link all I can, but not everything can be linked that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:9, topic:379992”][code]
[root@myhost Downloads]# cat /proc/version
Linux version 2.6.36-ARCH (tobias@T-POWA-LX) (gcc version 4.5.2 (GCC) ) #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat Jan 8 13:16:43 UTC 2011
[root@myhost Downloads]# ./sample_CommandLine.linux
bash: ./sample_CommandLine.linux: Permission denied

[/code]
Tried it on normal user and root.[/quote]

chmod +x sample_CommandLine.linux
./sample_CommandLine.linux

you might have forgotten to make it executable

Read full topic

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[code]mac1-001-m:Utilities matt$ /usr/bin/sw_vers
ProductName: Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.6.6
BuildVersion: 10J567

mac1-001-m:Shared matt$ ./sample_CommandLine_macosx_fat
Hello, world!
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Mac and Linux testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s snow leopard isn’t it? I honestly had no idea if it would run on that at all, so good to see that it did. I’ll be posting more complicated programs soon then for you to test. Thanks much.

Read full topic

I’ve recently set up a cross compiler so I can compile Linux, Windows, and Mac OSX programs all from Linux, and I can test Linux and Windows programs fairly well, but not OSX programs. Also different distributions of Linux tend to have different library versions, so that might be a problem too.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/test_cross/
